Package org.debugtrace.helper

Class Resource

java.lang.Object
org.debugtrace.helper.Resource
public class Resource extends Object
Uses this class when gets resources.
Since:
1.0.0
Author:
Masato Kokubo

    Returns the int value of resource property.
    Map<Integer,String>
    getIntegerKeyMap(String key)
    Returns a map (key: Integer, value: String) created from the resource property value if it is found, an empty map otherwise.

    Returns a list created from the resource property value if it is found, an empty list otherwise.

  • Constructor Details

    • Resource

      public Resource(Class<?> baseClass, String userBaseName)
      Construct a Resource.
      Parameters:
      baseClass - the base class of a system ResourceBundle
      userBaseName - the base name of an user ResourceBundle

  • Method Details

    • defaultResourceBundle

      public ResourceBundle defaultResourceBundle()
      Returns the default locale ResourceBundle.
      Returns:
      the default locale ResourceBundle

    • userResourceBundle

      public ResourceBundle userResourceBundle()
      Returns the user defined ResourceBundle.
      Returns:
      the user defined ResourceBundle

    • getValue

      public <V> V getValue(String key, Function<String,V> valueConverter, V defaultValue)
      Returns the value of resource property.
      Type Parameters:
      V - the type of value
      Parameters:
      key - the key of resource property
      valueConverter - the function to convert string to return type
      defaultValue - the default value
      Returns:
      the value of resource property (or defaultValue if not found in properties file)
      Throws:
      NullPointerException - if key or valueConverter is null
      Since:
      3.0.0

    • getString

      public String getString(String key, String defaultValue)
      Returns the string of resource property.
      Parameters:
      key - the key of resource property
      defaultValue - the default value
      Returns:
      the string value of resource property (or defaultValue if not found in properties file)
      Throws:
      NullPointerException - if key is null
      Since:
      2.3.0

    • getInt

      public int getInt(String key, int defaultValue)
      Returns the int value of resource property.
      Parameters:
      key - the key of resource property
      defaultValue - the default value
      Returns:
      the int value of resource property (or defaultValue if not found in properties file)
      Throws:
      NullPointerException - if key is null
      NumberFormatException - if the value can not convert to int
      Since:
      2.3.0

    • getList

      public <E> List<E> getList(String key, Function<String,E> valueConverter)
      Returns a list created from the resource property value if it is found, an empty list otherwise.
      Type Parameters:
      E - the type of elements of the list
      Parameters:
      key - the key of resource property
      valueConverter - the function to convert string to element type
      Returns:
      a created list (or an empty list)
      Throws:
      NullPointerException - if key or valueConverter is null
      Since:
      3.0.0

    • getSet

      public <E> Set<E> getSet(String key, Function<String,E> valueConverter)
      Returns a set created from the resource property value if it is found, an empty set otherwise.
      Type Parameters:
      E - the type of elements of the list
      Parameters:
      key - the key of resource property
      valueConverter - the function to convert string to element type
      Returns:
      a created set (or an empty set)
      Throws:
      NullPointerException - if key or valueConverter is null
      Since:
      3.1.1

    • getStrings

      public List<String> getStrings(String key)
      Returns a string list created from the resource property value if it is found, an empty list otherwise.
      Parameters:
      key - the key of resource property
      Returns:
      a created string list (or an empty list)
      Since:
      2.4.0

    • getStringSet

      public Set<String> getStringSet(String key)
      Returns a string set created from the resource property value if it is found, an empty set otherwise.
      Parameters:
      key - the key of resource property
      Returns:
      a created string set (or an empty set)
      Since:
      3.1.1

    • getMap

      public <K, V> Map<K,V> getMap(String key, Function<String,K> keyConverter, Function<String,V> valueConverter)
      Returns a map created from the resource property value if it is found, an empty map otherwise.
      Type Parameters:
      K - the type of keys of map
      V - the type of values of the map
      Parameters:
      key - the key of resource property
      keyConverter - the function that converts string to the key type of the map
      valueConverter - the function that converts string to the value type of the map
      Returns:
      a created map (or an empty map)
      Throws:
      NullPointerException - if key, keyConverter or valueConverter is null
      Since:
      3.0.0

    • getIntegerKeyMap

      public Map<Integer,String> getIntegerKeyMap(String key)
      Returns a map (key: Integer, value: String) created from the resource property value if it is found, an empty map otherwise.
      Parameters:
      key - the key of resource property
      Returns:
      a created map (or an empty map)
      Throws:
      NullPointerException - if key is null
      NumberFormatException - if the value can not convert to int
      Since:
      2.4.0

    • getStringKeyMap

      public Map<String,String> getStringKeyMap(String key)
      Returns a map (key: String, value: String) created from the resource property value if it is found, an empty map otherwise.
      Parameters:
      key - the key of resource property
      Returns:
      a created map (or an empty map)
      Throws:
      NullPointerException - if key is null
      Since:
      2.4.0
